intro: Kyllinga dorsocrena, commonly known as the velvetleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, dark green leaves and spike-like inflorescences. Kyllinga dorsocrena typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
